DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the feasibility, safety and short term effects on health related quality of life, of maintaining hemoglobin from 120 to 130 g/L versus from 100 to 110 g/L, with red cell concentrate (RCC) transfusion, in women having chemo-radiation for cancer of the cervix.
DOC.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Impact of Maintaining Hemoglobin Levels in Anemic Patients With Carcinoma of the Cervix
DOC.criteria: Previously untreated cervix cancer FIGO stage IB2, II, IIIB, IVA Suitable for treatment with radical intent using concurrent cisplatin and pelvic radiation Hemoglobin level above 125g/L Lower onethird vaginal involvement Paraaortic lymphadenopathy
